column2:
We've been made aware that scammers are attempting to impersonate True Names staff via email.

Any TNL communications will always come from @ens.domains. If you want to verify the veracity of a message, you can DM @ensdomains or @nicksdjohnson for verification.

feb 2022 ENS stats:

- 67k new .eth registrations (total 739k names)
- ~$4m in protocol revenue (all goes to the DAO)
- 28k new eth accounts w/ at least 1 ENS name (total 319k)
- 21 new integrations, total at 500
- >99% of OpenSea vol for domains https://t.co/ZD4nmuw7K5

ENS is a protocol that focusses on extensibility and upgradeability. This means our smart contract architecture is complicated with many moving parts.

Alex maps all of these contracts into this diagram and explains each part succinctly in this thread. https://t.co/zOtEzeI6Sy

The Sign-in with Ethereum open standard was initially kickstarted by @VitalikButerin, @ethereum foundation and ENS and is a pivotal part of the web3 stack.

Thank you @SpruceID for continually shipping excellent developer libraries and resources and bringing the standard forward. https://t.co/TBrQjbGNRo

ENS now has better support for the addresses of EVM-compatible chains.

You can specify an address, or else wallets should fall back to your ETH address. This involves a breaking-change for a small number of users.

Our dev @makoto_inoue explains:

https://t.co/huI16U3FrY #ens
